title: Oriental brushwork
creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
brief_description: Presents a historical sketch of Chinese art, emphasising the purity and restraint of Chinese brushwork and explaining that oriental artists seek to convey mood and emotion rather than a literal representation. Features paintings from the Freer Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C. Narrated by Eliot O’Hara.
